sentences: I get ready and leave home at 8.
I take the subway to work.
My office is on the 10th floor.
I say hello to my coworkers when I arrive.
At 9 a.m., I check my emails.
I reply to important messages first.
Then I have a short meeting with my team.
We talk about our tasks for the day.
After the meeting, I start working on my project.
Sometimes it's hard to focus because the office is noisy.
At 12:30, I go to lunch with a coworker.
We eat at a small restaurant near the office.
In the afternoon, I make some phone calls to clients.
I also write a report for my manager.
At 5:30, I turn off my computer and pack my bag.
Before I leave, I say goodbye to everyone.
I get home around 6:30 and feel tired, but good.
korean: 그런 다음 팀과 짧은 회의를 한다.
우리는 오늘 할 일에 대해 이야기한다.
회의 후에 나는 내 프로젝트 작업을 시작한다.
오후에는 고객에게 전화를 몇 통 한다.
퇴근하기 전에 모두에게 작별 인사를 한다.
explanations: Simple present tense used for daily routine.
Simple sentence with preposition of place 'on'.
Use of 'when' to indicate timing of the action.
Time expression first; then present tense verb.
Present simple verb 'reply' used with object.
Simple present tense with topic-focused verb.
Time clause + 'go to' as a fixed phrase.
Present simple for routine phone communication.
'Also' is used to add another action.
'Turn off' and 'pack' as two sequential verbs.
'Feel tired' and 'feel good' as emotional states.
